Porn is everywhere – and its super easy to find yourself watching tons more of it than you want to. If porn’s taking up heaps of your headspace and you want to cut down but can’t – you’re in the right place. It’s awesome you’re thinking about things and that you’re keen to change it up 👍 Kia Kaha.

Is it just me?

No 😊 – In a recent NZ study, 42% of young people who regularly watch porn wanted to watch less but found it hard not to(27). A Swedish study with young people showed similar results(28). Habits are super easy to fall into and harder to get out of – check out this video that shows how easily habits can start.

So, if you’re feeling like you want to cut down on porn, but can’t, you’re not alone! Here’s the d-low on why this might be happening…

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”0px||0px||true|false” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_image src=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/hippie.png” title_text=”hippie” show_bottom_space=”off” disabled_on=”off|on|off” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” max_width_tablet=”” max_width_phone=”58%” max_width_last_edited=”on|desktop” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”-50px||||false|false” custom_margin_tablet=”” custom_margin_phone=”0px||||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_padding=”0px||0px||true|false” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_5,3_5,1_5″ use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”2″ make_equal=”on” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” max_width=”1280px” custom_margin=”0px||0px||true|false” custom_padding=”0px||0px||true|false” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_5″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_image src=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/coffee-cup-illustration.png” title_text=”coffee-cup-illustration” show_bottom_space=”off” align=”right” align_tablet=”” align_phone=”center” align_last_edited=”on|phone” disabled_on=”on|off|off” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” transform_rotate=”0deg|0deg|338deg” max_width=”121px” module_alignment=”right” module_alignment_tablet=”center” module_alignment_phone=”center” module_alignment_last_edited=”on|phone” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”3_5″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text module_class=”body-text” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” custom_margin=”||||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]
Porn’s buzz

When we’re watching porn and being turned on, it feels good (duh) so it’s normal to want to go back for more, especially when we feel low.

The more we use porn to destress, it tells our bodies that porn can help us, and we can end up creating a pattern where using porn becomes a regular comfort or way to de-stress. So, it makes sense if you find yourself struggling to stop watching porn 😕 – it can happen without even realising.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_5″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”0px||0px||true|false” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#59848d” text_line_height=”1.2em” background_color=”#ffffff” background_enable_image=”off” background_size=”contain” transform_rotate=”0deg|0deg|3deg” text_orientation=”center” custom_margin=”-30px||||false|false” custom_margin_tablet=”” custom_margin_phone=”0px||||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_padding=”35px|20px|35px|20px|true|true” animation_style=”zoom” animation_direction=”left” animation_duration=”500ms” animation_delay=”400ms” animation_intensity_zoom=”83%” link_option_url_new_window=”on” custom_css_after=” content: ”;|| position: absolute;|| left: 0;|| top: 30%;|| width: 0;|| height: 0;|| border: 32px solid transparent;|| border-right-color: #FFF;|| border-left: 0;|| border-top: 0;|| margin-top: -16px;|| margin-left: -32px;||” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ box_shadow_blur=”55px” box_shadow_spread=”-2px” box_shadow_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.2)” global_colors_info=”{}”]

What’s Success?

Changing up porn habits is a process. Success is about taking one step at a time – like choosing to go for a run or call a mate when you feel stressed and want to jump into some porn.

It’s about putting one foot in front of the other, taking it day by day, and being brave.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_4,3_4″ make_equal=”on” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_image=”off” background_size=”contain” background_position=”bottom_right” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_image=”off” background_size=”contain” background_position=”bottom_center” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text disabled_on=”on|off|off” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#ffffff” text_font_size=”25px” text_line_height=”1.2em” background_color=”#a3afab” background_enable_image=”off” background_size=”contain” transform_rotate=”0deg|0deg|-3deg” text_orientation=”center” custom_padding=”35px|20px|35px|20px|true|true” animation_direction=”left” link_option_url_new_window=”on” custom_css_main_element=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” custom_css_after=” content: ”;|| position: absolute;|| right: 0;|| top: 20%;|| width: 0;|| height: 0;|| border: 32px solid transparent;|| border-left-color: #a3afab;|| border-right: 0;|| border-bottom: 0;|| margin-top: -16px;|| margin-right: -32px;||” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Anon youth, TLP Survey 2020

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”3_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text module_class=”body-text” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]
Porn,your brain and your sex life
It’s not new that sex and watching porn can cause our brains to fire out hormones causing a ‘rush’. For some young people, they want to keep going back for the ‘rush’ – but can then struggle to stop. For others, with time, the rush can take longer and longer to happen, so they start needing more extreme types of porn to get turned on. This can also impact real life sex, because some young people’s brains are so used to being turned on with porn, it can become harder (lol) to get turned on in real-life sex.  [/et_pb_text][et_pb_text disabled_on=”off|on|on” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#ffffff” text_font_size=”25px” text_line_height=”1.2em” background_color=”#a3afab” background_enable_image=”off” background_size=”contain” transform_rotate=”0deg|0deg|-3deg” text_orientation=”center” custom_padding=”35px|20px|35px|20px|true|true” animation_direction=”left” link_option_url_new_window=”on” custom_css_main_element=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” custom_css_after=” content: ”;|| position: absolute;|| right: 0;|| top: 20%;|| width: 0;|| height: 0;|| border: 32px solid transparent;|| border-left-color: #a3afab;|| border-right: 0;|| border-bottom: 0;|| margin-top: -16px;|| margin-right: -32px;||” global_colors_info=”{}”]

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text module_class=”body-text” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”||40px||false|false” custom_padding_tablet=”” custom_padding_phone=”||0px||false|false” custom_padding_last_edited=”on|phone” global_colors_info=”{}”]
The flow – what’s happening?
Scientists talk about ‘flow’ – when you’re so into what you’re doing, you lose track of time and nothing else matters… like when you game or surf and just wanna go on forever. This can happen while watching porn – especially when the flow ends in a great rush. If we’re in the flow our brains are in the perfect zone for learning and developing new habits. This makes it super easy for us to develop patterns around our porn usage or sexual desires and expectations, without even realising it.[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_4,1_2,1_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” max_width=”1280px” custom_margin=”0px||0px||true|false” custom_padding=”0px||0px||true|false” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_image src=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/dude-with-cool-hair.png” title_text=”dude-with-cool-hair” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” transform_rotate=”0deg|0deg|27deg” max_width=”220px” module_alignment=”right” module_alignment_tablet=”center” module_alignment_phone=”center” module_alignment_last_edited=”on|phone” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text module_class=”body-text” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]
Culture, faith and shame
People from cultures or faiths where porn is a no-no can often experience more shame and guilt about their porn use than other young people, regardless of how much porn they watch. They are also less likely to talk or reach out to people for help because of the shame surrounding porn. If this is you, it’s hard to go it alone – so find someone safe who can support you – like an older sibling, cousin or school counsellor.[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” text_font=”|300|||||||” text_text_color=”#ffffff” text_font_size=”25px” text_line_height=”1.3em” header_text_color=”#0a0a0a” background_color=”#b89a54″ transform_rotate=”0deg|0deg|3deg” text_orientation=”center” custom_padding=”35px|35px|35px|35px|true|true” custom_css_before=”content: ”;|| position: absolute;|| left: 0;|| top: 70%;|| width: 0;|| height: 0;|| border: 32px solid transparent;|| border-right-color: #b89a54;|| border-left: 0;|| border-top: 0;|| margin-top: -16px;|| margin-left: -32px;” custom_css_main_element=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’;” global_colors_info=”{}”]Porn can make us feel good ‘in the moment’ – but can get tricky when it’s overused to de-stress and/or ends up creating patterns without us even realizing, that are hard to break.[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ admin_label=”tab-three-row” module_id=”tab-three-row” module_class=”monitor-frame tabs tabs-tab” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#ffffff” background_image=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/headphones-bg-xs.png” background_position=”top_center” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,2_3″ use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”1″ make_equal=”on” _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_image=”off” background_size=”contain” background_position=”center_right” width_tablet=”” width_phone=”95%” width_last_edited=”on|desktop” height=”150px” overflow-x=”visible” overflow-y=”visible” custom_css_before=”content:’ ‘;||background-image: url(%22/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dotted-ants-top-loopbig.svg%22);||height: 200px;
